newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Jakarta stocks seen flat, tone cautious on rupiah.
newsitem.headline: Jakarta stocks seen flat, tone cautious on rupiah.

text.p: Jakarta stocks are seen flat in slow trading on Tuesday, with sentiment seen remaining cautious following recent volatility of the rupiah, brokers said.
"Sentiment, particularly on the banking stocks, is likely to stay cautious due to the volatile rupiah," one broker with a large local brokerage firm said.
Banking stocks came under strong selling pressure in the past several days following the volatile rupiah and the central bank's curb on property loans, brokers said.
Rupiah continued to recover against the dollar in early trading on Tuesday after previously sliding on regional turbulence, bank dealers said.
Brokers said local active buying in second-liners due mostly to speculative buying was likely to limit any possible sharp downtrend.
Stocks to watch include second-liner retailer Multipolar on market talk of a possible upward revision in the firm's 1997 net profit forecast, brokers said.
On Monday the Jakarta composite index ended down 0.91 points at 722.50 points. -- Jakarta newsroom +6221 384-6364
